info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 5:24PM EDT until July 23 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.5 to 7.7 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston).
* WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties.
* WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties.
ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 7:52 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible up to 2 hours before and after high tide. The most significant impacts will occur in Downtown Charleston where flooded roadways are likely. Expect road closures. Some roads could also flood with water approaching buildings along the back side of Folly Beach, Edisto Beach and Isle of Palms. Long Point Road in Mount Pleasant may also flood and become impassable.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING
